title: The Bishop confined himself to the remark:--
body: The Bishop confined himself to the remark:--"I am pleased to see that I have been misinformed.You certainly do not seem to me to be ill.""Monsieur," replied the old man, "I am going to recover."He paused, and then said:--"I shall die three hours hence."Then he continued:--"I am something of a doctor; I know in what fashion the last hour draws on.Yesterday, only my feet were cold; to-day, the chill has ascended to my knees; now I feel it mounting to my waist; when it reaches the heart, I shall stop.The sun is beautiful, is it not?I had myself wheeled out here to take a last look at things.You can talk to me; it does not fatigue me.You have done well to come and look at a man who is on the point of death. It is well that there should be witnesses at that moment.One has one's caprices; I should have liked to last until the dawn, but I know that I shall hardly live three hours.It will be night then. What does it matter, after all?Dying is a simple affair. One has no need of
author: 0xA80585Cef5FF9dFFB4F00Dbe2810242AfeA1c57D
